ml.alternet.parser

Annotation Type Grammar.WhitespacePolicy


  • @Documented
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value={TYPE,FIELD})
public static @interface Grammar.WhitespacePolicy
    Indicates how to process whitespaces during parsing. When specified on a grammar, the annotation applies on every token not annotated. A non-annotated token of a non-annotated grammar will preserve whitespaces.
    Author:
    Philippe Poulard

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Class<? extends Predicate<Integer>> isWhitespace
      A predicate that tells whether a character is a whitespace or not.
      boolean preserve
      Indicates whether whitespaces have to be preserved or not.

    • Element Detail

      • preserve

        public abstract boolean preserve
        Indicates whether whitespaces have to be preserved or not. An annotated item will ignore them by default, but a specific token can preserve them while its grammar is annotated to ignore them.
        Returns:
        true to preserve whitespaces, false otherwise.
        Default:
        false

      • isWhitespace

        public abstract Class<? extends Predicate<Integer>> isWhitespace
        A predicate that tells whether a character is a whitespace or not.
        Returns:
        The predicate by default is JavaWhitespace.
        Default:
        ml.alternet.scan.JavaWhitespace.class
